English: That wasn't bad. For a Russian.
Hey, thanks. Like I said I am glad to help but I am in ned of getting back to Kolguyev, to my army.
I hear you, man, I truly do, but that's not something I can grant you. You would have to discuss that with our leader.
Nah, that's not our leader. He's actually second in command. Our movement is led by...
You've done well enough, Russian, you can come with us to the north for now.
I'd rather head in the direction of Kolguyev, Jean.
That's not possible at the moment. The enemy patrols the sea and coast looking for any Soveit units left behind.\nYou should wait for a few days before attempting to slip by.
Our commander will have some ideas, but he's in the south and that's not our direction. It's too hot down there.\nBut I tell you if you help us we will help you.
But I did already help you, didn't I?
No, you merely earned your place among us. You have yet to earn our help. Stick to Pierre, I'll see you later.
